title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: No children nodes are listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: The children nodes should be listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Ensure that the new data source has no database, table, or column information. 3. Open the data set editor page of the query tab. 4. Change the data source for the data set. 5. Observe that no children nodes are listed. 6. Close the data set editor and reopen it. 7. Verify that the children nodes are now listed.
